p: Amla is the fruit of a tree from the family Phyllanthaceae, which is used as fresh fruit, jam, or electuary ( Yadav etÂ al., 2017). In TPM, amla fruit is considered as a cardiotonic and cardioprotective medicine that is useful for treating cardiovascular problems. Amla also prevents humors from infection and thus acts as a general tonic, i.e. strengthens the body against infection ( Aghili Khorasani, 1771 AD).
